revised_title: On the Structure and Development of the Cysticercus Cellulosae in Pigs
tldr: The author examines the structure and development of the Cysticercus cellulosae, a parasitic cyst found in pigs, and describes its various stages of growth, including the formation of suctorial disks, hooklets, and laminated calcareous bodies. The study provides insights into the entozoon's ability to penetrate and develop within the host's muscular tissues.
